intro: Spermacoce diodioides, commonly known as the small starburry, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and it has a distinctive, hairy stem covered in glandular dots. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce diodioides is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
